result.execSummary:
The defendant Conor D Ulik was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 6-06-2016 or civil judgment.
*Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Court stays report date to 12-07-2015 by 12pm.

charges.descr: Endangering Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Under the Influence of Intoxicant)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Conor D Ulik

defendant.name: Ulik, Conor D
defendant.address: 2954 South 92nd Street, L2, West Allis, WI 53227

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 12/10/15 bail refund notice mailed to surety.

Defendant Conor D Ulik in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties.  
The court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, with credit for 1 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work.  Court stays report date to 12-07-2015 by 12pm. 

Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges by 6-06-2016 or civil judgment.  

filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Conor D Ulik in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing.  For reasons stated on the record, defense requests an adjourned date. Court orders case adjourned to branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Conor D Ulik in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case calendared for plea/sentencing. Court granted the Defense's motion to adjourn, however, will not grant any further adjournments. Any motions are to be filed on the next court date. Case adjourned in branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Conor D Ulik in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Conor D Ulik in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case heard off the record. Defense counsel requests another pretrial conference date. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case adjourned to Br 45.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Filed, Letter From Attorney Michael Hayes Confirming June 11, 2015 Pre-Trial Date
Attorney Hayes contacted court to reschedule 06-04-2015 pretrial conference.  Case scheduled for Pretrial conference on 06-11-2015 at 8:30 am

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Conor D Ulik in court with attorney Michael M. Hayes.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 46.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/23/15 @ 1:30pm
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 03/28/15
